title: You can stay in the 'Jersey Shore' house, so time to GTL
text:
It's T-shirt time!

The Seaside Heights, New Jersey, house made famous by the show 'Jersey Shore' can be yours -- for $2,000 per night.

Booking.com

Booking.com

Before balking at the price, keep in mind it does sleep 11. And it does have a duck phone.

Booking.com

Booking.com

The Booking.com listing says the house has six bedrooms, but only one bathroom. No wonder the cast was always arguing.

The closest beach is just 30 feet from the house, according to the listing. The boardwalk is a short 4-minute walk away.

The property has just one review so far on the website, which gave it a rating of 7.5 out of 10. It noted that there was plenty of room, but guests had to bring their own sheets. Probably a good idea.

Booking.com

While the rooftop terrace is still equipped with lounge chairs, a grill and a picnic table, it appears the Jacuzzi has been removed, but again, that's probably for the best.
description: House made famous by the MTV show 'Jersey Shore' is available to rent.
